wordageddon.model

Class TextAnalysisService

  • java.lang.Object
    • wordageddon.model.TextAnalysisService

  • public class TextAnalysisService
extends java.lang.Object
    Service for analyzing text documents and "tokenize" their content into a Document-Term Matrix (DTM). Handles text normalization, stopword filtering, and Document-Term Matrix population.
    Since:
    2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Gregorio Barberio, Francesco Peluso, Davide Quaranta, Ciro Ronca

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TextAnalysisService()
      Constructs a new TextAnalysisService with an empty stopwords set.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      DocumentTermMatrix createDocumentTermMatrix(java.util.List<java.lang.String> documents, java.util.Set<java.lang.String> currentStopwords)
      Creates a Document Term Matrix from a list of document contents and stopwords.
      void loadStopwords(java.io.File stopwordsFile)
      Loads stopwords from the specified file.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main method for testing TextAnalysisService functionality.
      void processDocument(DocumentTermMatrix dtm, java.io.File file)
      Processes a single document and adds its terms to the DTM.
      void processDocuments(DocumentTermMatrix dtm, java.io.File documentsDir)
      Processes all .txt files in the specified directory and adds their terms to the DTM.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TextAnalysisService

        public TextAnalysisService()
        Constructs a new TextAnalysisService with an empty stopwords set. Note: by default, the service does not load any stopwords. You should load them using loadStopwords(File) for proper functionality.

    • Method Detail

      • loadStopwords

        public void loadStopwords(java.io.File stopwordsFile)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Loads stopwords from the specified file. The file should contain one stopword per line. Comments are supported (lines starting with "//" are ignored).
        Parameters:
        stopwordsFile - the file containing stopwords to load
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file cannot be read

      • processDocuments

        public void processDocuments(DocumentTermMatrix dtm,
                             java.io.File documentsDir)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Processes all .txt files in the specified directory and adds their terms to the DTM.
        Parameters:
        dtm - the Document-Term Matrix to populate
        documentsDir - the directory containing .txt files to process
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the directory is invalid or files cannot be read

      • processDocument

        public void processDocument(DocumentTermMatrix dtm,
                            java.io.File file)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Processes a single document and adds its terms to the DTM.
        Parameters:
        dtm - the Document-Term Matrix to populate
        file - the file to process
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file cannot be read

      • createDocumentTermMatrix

        public DocumentTermMatrix createDocumentTermMatrix(java.util.List<java.lang.String> documents,
                                                   java.util.Set<java.lang.String> currentStopwords)
        Creates a Document Term Matrix from a list of document contents and stopwords.
        Parameters:
        documents - list of document contents as strings
        stopwords - set of stopwords to filter out
        Returns:
        a new DocumentTermMatrix populated with the processed documents

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method for testing TextAnalysisService functionality.
        Parameters:
        args - command line arguments (not used)
